attributes.action: Separate care and treatment for women suffering a miscarriage.
attributes.additional_details: To create a separate space/ departments whereby women and couples whom experience loss can grieve without having to witness others happiness at their misfortune. Often women and are placed in a cleaners cupboard space to grieve initially because there often isn't a dedicated space for them. This must change.
attributes.background: Currently women have to endure the horrendous torture of sitting often in early pregnancy units or wards when suffering miscarriage. They have to sit alongside women and couples whose pregnancies are viable. This is inhumane and heartbreaking, and morally wrong.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action:

Require the NHS have separate gynaecology units for women who are not pregnant: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616635

We have also published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Fund improved services for families experiencing baby loss: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/624047
